articles.title: Anthropic tells US judge it will pay $1.5 billion to settle author class action
articles.summary: Anthropic told a San Francisco federal judge on Friday that it has agreed to pay $1.5 billion to settle a class-action lawsuit from a group of authors who accused the artificial intelligence company of using their books to train its AI chatbot Claude without permission.

articles.title: Amazon-backed Anthropic agrees to pay authors $1.5B to settle AI copyright lawsuit

articles.title: AI company Anthropic agrees to pay $1.5 billion to settle lawsuit from authors
articles.summary: Anthropic, a major artificial intelligence company, agreed to pay at least $1.5 billion to settle a copyright infringement lawsuit filed by a group of authors who alleged the platform had illegally used pirated copies of their books to train large-language models, according to court documents.“If approved, this landmark settlement will be the largest publicly reported copyright recovery in history, larger than any other copyright class action settlement or any individual copyright case litigated to final judgment,” said Justin Nelson, a lawyer for the authors

articles.title: Powered Restoration of Orson Welles' Lost Masterpiece
articles.summary: Orson Welles' legendary masterpiece, which was partially destroyed, is set for a new restoration using generative artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Anthropic to pay authors to settle lawsuit over chatbot training
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence company Anthropic has agreed to pay $1.5 billion to settle a class-action lawsuit by book authors who say the company took pirated copies of their works to train its chatbot.
